questions.text: What are the antidotes used for cyanide toxicity? Amyl nitrite Sodium nitrite Sodium thiosulfate Glyceryl trinitrite Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1, 2 & 3 Cyanide removal from the body is a complex process. It needs amyl nitrite, sodium nitrite and sodium thiosulphate.

Highyeild:

Treatment of cyanide poisoning The principle of the treatment is to reverse the cyanide-cytochrome This is achieved by converting hemoglobin to methemoglobin by giving nitrites. Methaemoglobin has a higher binding affinity for cyanide than the cytochrome oxidase complex, and removes cyanide from the cytochrome oxidase. Cyanides combine with methaemoglobin and form non-toxic cyanmethemoglobin which in the presence of rhodanase and sulphate donors, such as thiosulphate, converts cyanide to thiocyanate which is excreted in the urine. Cyanide is directly converted to thiocyanate by the complexing of cyanide with thiosulphate under the influence of the enzyme rhodanase. Cyanide is also converted to cyanocobalamin (Vit B 12 ) by complexing with hydroxocobalamin (Vit B 12 A). Cytochrome oxides + NaCN⇒ Cytochrome oxidase cyanide Sodium nitrite + Hb⇒ methaemoglobin Methaemoglobin + NaCN⇒ Cyan-methaemoglobin Cyanide kit: 12 amyl nitrite pearls, two 10 ml. vials of 3% sodium nitrite and two 50 ml. vials of sodium thiosulphate.

questions.text: The declaration of Oslo is about:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Therapeutic abortion The Declaration of Oslo was about therapeutic abortion.

Highyeild:

WMA statement on medically-indicated termination of pregnancy (Adopted by the 24th World Medical Assembly, Oslo, Norway, August 1970) Physicians should be aware of local termination of pregnancy laws, regulations and reporting requirements. The procedure should be performed by a competent physician and only in extreme cases by another qualified health care worker. The convictions of both the physician and the patient should be respected. Patients must be supported appropriately and provided with necessary medical and psychological treatment along with appropriate counseling if desired. Physicians have a right to conscientious objection to performing an abortion; therefore, they may withdraw while ensuring the continuity of medical care by a qualified colleague. In all cases, physicians must perform those procedures necessary to save the woman’s life and to prevent serious injury to her health.

The physician shall not countenance, condone or participate in the practice of torture or other forms of cruel, inhuman or degrading procedures, whatever the offense of which the victim of such procedures is suspected, accused or guilty, and whatever the victim’s beliefs or motives, and in all situations, including armed conflict and civil strife. Option: C. Human experimentation WMA declaration of Helsinki – Ethical principles for medical research involving human subjects. It is the duty of physicians who are involved in medical research to protect the life, health, dignity, integrity, right to self-determination, privacy, and confidentiality of personal information of research subjects. The responsibility for the protection of research subjects must always rest with the physician or other health care professionals and never with the research subjects, even though they have given consent. Physicians must consider the ethical, legal and regulatory norms and standards for research involving human subjects in their own countries as well as applicable international norms and standards. Option: D. Pronouncement of Death WMA declaration of Sydney on the determination of death and the recovery of organs. Determination of death can be made on the basis of the irreversible cessation of all functions of the entire brain, including the brain stem, or the irreversible cessation of circulatory and respiratory functions. This determination will be based on clinical judgment according to accepted criteria, supplemented, if necessary, by standard diagnostic procedures, and it will be made by a physician.

questions.text: A middle-aged housewife consumed rodenticide powder and was present with K+ levels of 2.5meq. Examination shows irregular pulse with muscle paralysis. ECG shows ventricular ectopics. What is the suspected poison?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Barium carbonate Barium causes hypokalemia and cardiac arrhythmia.

Highyeild:

Barium Mechanism of action Barium induces hypokalemia by two mechanisms: It competitively blocks potassium channels, which are responsible for the efflux of intracellular K+ out of the cell. Directly decreases cell membrane permeability to Na+. This leads to a shift of extracellular potassium into the cell. Intracellular trapping of K+ leads to (i) depolarization and paralysis (ii) decreases vascular resistance and reduces blood flow, hypertension and lactic acidosis. Direct toxicity to skeletal muscle and neuromuscular transmission. Hypokalemia occurs within 2 hours of exposure. Signs and symptoms Severe GIT irritation – (a) Nausea, Abdominal pain, vomiting, diarrhea occur within 1 hour of ingestion. (b) Esophagitis (c) hemorrhagic gastritis Signs and symptoms associated with hypokalemia - (a) ventricular dysrhythmia (b) hypertension (c) profound flaccid muscle weakness (d) respiratory failure (e) lactic acidosis, (f) hypophosphatemia (g) rhabdomyolysis Secondary to tissue ischemia - (a) Altered level of consciousness (b) seizures (c) basal ganglia manifestations.
